2016.short_bio: Technology stack includes Python, Elasticsearch, Hadoop, SAS, Linux to deliver various projects
bio: I have been involved in various client-side software engineering projects through my employment. I completed a bespoke training academy covering Object-Oriented design, Java Enterprise, Testing processes, and software lifecycles. Which resulted in multiple professional certifications including Oracle Certified Associate - Java SE 7 Programmer

Current Project - Selected to be part of a small team to provide Data Engineering capability for the COVID-19 response for one of our clients. I worked with a range of API’s and data access points to automate the data ingest process to provide up to date data for the the data scientist and data analysts. Using AWS products such as S3, Lambda, and CloudWatch. Also using processes as Infrastructure-as-code to create repeatable deployment pipelines.

Project 1 - Due to COVID-19 our forward deployed software development team, moved to remote working. Our team moved to further develop a bespoke capability for Project 2. The capability is provides an end to end solution for data ingestion, extraction, and statistical analysis on the new data. I produced software designs on how the transfer of data between micro services would be implemented. Once agreed upon, I implemented the design and created documentation for the team to follow when implementing new micro services to the solution.

Project 2 - As part of the forward deployed software development team, working closely with stakeholders to understand their data and turn it into actionable decisions. Day to day tasks include working with a range of data formats, building reusable data pipelines to transform and standardise data into a conformed schema, data exploration for data quality issues and schema discovery. As well as building a tool to monitor data landing, a script to check the integrity of Parquet files in transit, building small web apps to help analysts to complete mundane tasks quickly.

Project 3 - Co-Leading a team of 4 software developers using agile methodologies to deliver and support a bespoke mission critical data analysis framework which turns a daily stream of ~1TB of raw data into rich valuable data through manipulation and enrichments for our analysts. The framework consists of python micro-services, Object orientated component’s, web services using Flask, Behaviour driven development, Unit and integration testing, and version control. I used Jira to plan sprints, confluence to document code and record retrospectives.
achievements: Delivering mission critical bespoke software engineering projects.

Communicate with Management, Stakeholders, and end users directly to understand requirements, issues and steps forward. Which resulted in winning the trust of clients and strengthening the company relationship.
Leading and mentoring Interns and junior staff.
Co-leading a team to deliver software on time.
Working with agile methodologies to deliver iterative project updates.

2016.qualification: Oracle Certified Associate, Java SE 7 Programmer
2016.short_bio: Oracle Certified Associate Java Programmer (OCAJP 7) is an associate-level certification that validates your basic skills of writing code with fundamental concepts of Java SE 7.
The Foundation Level syllabus forms the basis of the International Software Testing Qualifications Board (ISTQB®) Certified Tester Scheme.
Supporting the IT Systems team to deploy new OS and provide technical support to lectures.
bio:
As a temporary help for the departments IT Systems team, tasks I had to perform included imaging lab pc's, installing new pc's, 
testing new OS after they have been deployed and providing low level technical support to staff and students.
Working in the departments system team I can learn more about how a business' infrastructure is managed, supported and maintained.
achievements: Developing a good reputation with lectures and the IT team
Understanding business infrastructure and deployment on a large scale
Provide extra help for the IT team
Deploy PC images for the start of term
Provide Technical support to the lectures

2015.short_bio: Working within the NHS radiotherapy department to support on going research.
bio: As Part of a Collaboration with the University of Hull and NHS Castle Hill Hospital. Working with the Radiotherapy Physics Department to help develop a C# script to work on Eclipse (Varian Medical Systems) to create a tool to support research in radiotherapy.
The Aim of the tool is to aid in the quality assurance process of the treatment plans
achievements: Develop research software for an NHS department
Working with the NHS to develop/further understand the Varian system
Provide a platform for the NHS team to further develop

2014.short_bio: Working within Hull universities Immersive Virtual Environment to develop a Virtual reality Star Wars like experience.
bio: I worked on a project within Hull Immersive Virtual Environment, which investigated using hand held devices to aid in Virtual Environments.
Using a Wii remote, Unity, Virtual Reality Peripheral Network and a back projected 4-sided cube, I created a Star Wars based game in which the user used the Wii remote to controller the lightsaber.
achievements: Research into my chosen project
Develop a prototype application
Created a working prototype
Understanding Virtual Reality technology
Working to deadlines

2012.short_bio: Working as full time at the London 2012 olympics in partnership with G4S and Bridging the Gap project to provide spectator safety.
bio: This was a full-time security position working on the Olympic Park for the London 2012 Olympic & Paralympic Games.
During this time, I worked closely with the Armed Forces as part of the radiation team, scanning visitors as they entered the park for increased levels of radiation.

I had to be alert and react quickly to any alerts. I also worked on the personal security areas (PSA), bag searching and body searching visitors to the park. I also used the x-ray machine to pre-search bags.
achievements: First line of security for the Olympic park
Proactive in maintain customers safety
Provide help and assistance to customers
Developed skills outside of my comfort zone
